content:
I think I'll start with the seasonal project, capturing the changing seasons. I've always loved how the light and colors change throughout the year, and it'll be a great opportunity to experiment with different techniques and compositions. I'll choose a specific location, like a park or a trail, and visit it regularly to capture the transformation. Maybe I can even try to capture the same scene at the same time every year to see how it changes over time.

But I also like the idea of doing a themed project, like street photography or wildlife and nature. I've always been fascinated by the beauty of the natural world, and capturing it on camera would be an amazing experience. Maybe I can combine the two projects and focus on capturing the changing seasons in a natural setting, like a forest or a wetland.

Do you have any tips on how to stay motivated and committed to a photography project?
